beantype.name: org.rapidbeans.rapidenv.config.expr.ConfigExprFunctionOsname
beantype.description: Determine the operating system (family) name of the underlying node. Currently the following operating systems (families) are recognized: linux, windows, mac

property.name: conversionmap
property.description: Maps certain operating system (family) names to other strings. The map is specified the following way: <osname>=<mapped packaging> [,<osname>=<mapped pckaging>] ... e.g. the expression "eclipse-modeling-indigo-''osname('windows=win32,linux=linux-gtk')''architecture('x86=,i386=;x86_64=-x86_64').packaging()" will result into following mappings: OS: windows, ARCH: x86 (32 Bit) => eclipse-modeling-indigo-win32.zip OS: windows, ARCH: x86_64 (64 Bit) => eclipse-modeling-indigo-win32-x86_64.zip OS: linux, ARCH: i386 (32 Bit) => eclipse-modeling-indigo-linux-gtk.tar.gz OS: linux, ARCH: x86_64 (64 Bit) => eclipse-modeling-indigo-linux-gtk-x86_64.tar.gz

property.name: returnval
property.description: The operation system (family) of the underlying node.
